title: Multiplayer Simulation Game-Based Learning for Enhancing Veterinary Decision-Making Systems Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational veterinary science theories and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Graduate-level veterinary education course: Aims to understand interconnectedness of animal/public/environmental health systems; requires flexible BYOD-aligned learning design

learning_goals: Applying systems thinking approaches in complex veterinary scenarios to make decisions considering four or more interrelated elements (animal, public, environment, economy)
Enhancing knowledge sharing and role allocation skills among team members through collaborative problem-solving processes conducted three or more times in multiplayer simulation games
Achieving decision-making abilities incorporating ethical/practical considerations with over 80% accuracy in simulation environments resembling real clinical cases by the end of the six-month course
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
